definition: to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: A transferee who is dissatisfied with such an order may apply for review not more than once.
sentences.chinese: 受讓人對裁定不服的，可以申請複議一次。

sentences.english: Users of popular Twitter-like microblogging service Sina Weibo were likewise disbelieving.
sentences.chinese: 新浪微博的用戶也同樣不相信這個裁定結果。

sentences.english: He says progress towardld the eight goals should be judged nation-by-nation.
sentences.chinese: 他說這八個目標的進程應從各國的角度來裁定。

sentences.english: He was convicted by a jury.
sentences.chinese: 他被陪審團裁定罪名成立。

sentences.english: Common sense, logic and the trend in the law supports this decision.
sentences.chinese: 普通常識，邏輯以及法律的趨勢都支持了這個裁定。

sentences.english: The verdict throws more uncertainty into the Republican rocky re-election bid.
sentences.chinese: 這個裁定給共和黨的連任選舉增加了更多的不確定性。

sentences.english: The jury arrives at its verdict in the seclusion of the jury room.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團在隔離的評議室裏作出裁定。

sentences.english: Forgiving the perpetrator for his action does not mean you stop judging the deed.
sentences.chinese: 原諒犯事者並不代表你已經停止裁定這件事。

sentences.english: On Tuesday, the court refused to rehear an appeal from the two companies to review the June decision.
sentences.chinese: 週二，法院駁回兩家公司關於6月裁定的重審上訴。

sentences.english: A and B accept Xs ruling, play extra holes and A wins.
sentences.chinese: 和B接受了X的裁定，打了加洞賽，最後A勝出。

sentences.english: The right to impose such sanctions lies inprinciple with the Association or the organiser of the competition concerned.
sentences.chinese: 處罰等行爲的實施權應由協會或賽事組織方裁定。

sentences.english: But thefencing body said Shin's defeat was entirely legitimate.
sentences.chinese: 但擊劍組織稱申雅蘭的失敗是完全合法裁定的。

sentences.english: Both companies claimed that the WTO's latest ruling bolstered their case.
sentences.chinese: 兩家公司都認爲世貿組織的最新裁定是己方獲勝。

sentences.english: A written order to suspend or terminate execution shall become effective immediately after being served on the parties concerned.
sentences.chinese: 中止和終結執行的裁定，送達當事人後立即生效。

sentences.english: She was a huge tigress and ruled for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個巨大的母老虎，並裁定了很長一段時間。

sentences.english: She kept hundreds of copies of court verdicts, piled high, until her death.
sentences.chinese: 她保留了無數的法院裁定書，高束藏起，直至去逝。

definition: judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
to amend a judgment/to overrule the original decision/to commute (a sentence)
to protest against a verdict/to lodge an appeal
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
